Uses of Class
com.ibm.watson.dsm.DSMException

  • Packages that use DSMException 
    Package Description
    com.ibm.watson.dsm
    Provides some basic classes used throughout the DSM framework.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine
    Provides a framework for rule evaluation over data shared from within database tables.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.analysis
    Provides a concrete rules engine that generates all possible end tuple states that can result from a rule evaluation.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.app
    Provides a concrete rules engine that uses the SharedTuplePlatform to exchange tuples between engines.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.parser.sql
    Provides a parser and object model for an SQL-based rule language..
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform
    Provides the basic framework for sharing data within or between JVMs.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.beans
    Provides extensions to the ISharedDataPlatform to support the sharing of serialized Java objects.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.beans.jexl
    Provides support for Jave Expression Language-based conditions on shared bean data.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.messaging
    Provides a framework for sending and receiving messages.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.messaging.dual
    Provides ability to send and receive messages to and from both within a JVM instance and between JVM instances.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.messaging.memory
    Provides in-memory (intra-JVM) message senders and receivers.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.messaging.network
    Provides network-based (inter-JVM) message senders and receivers.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.monitor
    Provides a framework for monitoring the operation of the AbstractSharedData platform.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.monitor.debugger
    Provides a client/server platform monitoring pair.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology
    Provides framework for physical and logical topology representation and monitoring.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.application
    Provides a framework for applications to define logical topolical relationships between nodes.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.centralized  
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.star
    Provides a physical topology implementation using a separate IDistributedApplicationRegistry implementation and thus assumes a fully connected network of nodes.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.registry
    Provides an application registry framework that allows applications to discover how communicate with each other.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.registry.fixed
    Provides support for a static registry of applications defined in a file.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.registry.wpml
    Provides a WPML PEP repository-based application registry.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.tuples
    Provides extensions to the ISharedDataPlatform to support the sharing of relational data.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.tuples.storage
    Provides various tuple storage implementations.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.dataHandler
    Provides a data caching and de-duplication framework.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.gaian
    Provides a distributed neighbor monitoring system for the gaian database nodes.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.stash
    Provides simplified distributed named data sharing services.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.tools
    Provides command line tool implementations.
    com.ibm.watson.dsm.util
    Provides some utility classes that may be useful across multiple components.

      Methods in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine that throw DSMException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void AbstractRuleEngine.addTuples(ITupleSet... tuples) 
      void IRuleEngine.addTuples(ITupleSet... tuples)
      Add the given input or transport tuples to the engine for processing.
      void AbstractRuleEngine.addTuples(java.lang.String table, ITuple... tuples) 
      void IRuleEngine.addTuples(java.lang.String table, ITuple... tuples)
      A convenience method over IRuleEngine.addTuples(ITupleSet...) that create a tuple set for the given tuples using the underlying storage's ITupleSetDescriptor for the table with the given name.
      protected ITupleSet AbstractRuleEngine.applyChoose(DSMSQLStatement s, int recursiveQueryIndex, ITupleSet tuples, int maxCount, int minCount)
      Apply the choose=n and optional choose_min=m modifiers to results of this statements select clause.
      protected void AbstractRuleEngine.createStorage()
      Create the tables declared by the rules file.
      protected void AbstractRuleEngine.evaluateTupleRules(boolean isInsert, ITupleSet... tuples)
      Implements the rule evaluation algorithm after applying the given set of tuples as either an add or a delete (deletes are not currently supported).
      protected abstract void AbstractRuleEngine.evaluationComplete()
      Provided so that sub-classes can log changes in state or other info.
      protected java.lang.String AbstractRuleEngine.getTableListing()
      Used for debugging to shows the tables and their contents.
      protected java.util.List<ITupleSet> AbstractRuleEngine.getTuples(DSMSQLStatement.StatementType statementType)
      Get a list of all tuples sets in the rule engine of the given type, excluding any that were declared with the AUTOMATIC modifier.
      protected NamedTuples AbstractRuleEngine.getTuples(java.util.List<java.lang.String> tables)
      Get a map of all tuples in tuple storage for the named tables in the given list.
      ITupleSet AbstractRuleEngine.getTuples(java.lang.String table) 
      ITupleSet IRuleEngine.getTuples(java.lang.String table)
      Get all rows from the named table.
      TupleState AbstractRuleEngine.getTupleState()
      Gets the current set of tuples in the tables, excluding any tables defined with the AUTOMATIC modifier.
      TupleState IRuleEngine.getTupleState()
      Get the current set of Input, Transient, Persistent and Transport tuples and store them in a new instance of TupleState.
      protected abstract void AbstractRuleEngine.sendTransportTuples(NamedTuples after)
      The subclass can decide about how/when to send the transport tuples.
      void AbstractRuleEngine.start() 
      void IRuleEngine.start()
      Start the engine and any threads associated with it and reset any state held by the instance.
      void AbstractRuleEngine.stop() 
      void IRuleEngine.stop()
      Stop the engine and any threads created during it's use.
      protected void AbstractRuleEngine.updateTuples(ITupleSet[] add, ITupleSet[] delete)
      Apply tuple additions or deletions (both at the same time not supported), however AbstractRuleEngine.evaluateTupleRules(boolean, ITupleSet...) no longer supports deletes.

    • Uses of DSMException in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.analysis

      Methods in com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.analysis that throw DSMException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected ITupleSet AnalysisEngine.applyChoose(DSMSQLStatement s, int recursiveEvalIndex, ITupleSet tuples, int maxCount, int minCount)
      Overrides the super class to cause recursive evaluations with all possible combinations of tuples implied by the choose request.
      protected void AnalysisEngine.evaluateTupleRules(boolean isInsert, ITupleSet... tuples)
      Capture the initial state and given inputs in case we need to recurse on this method via AnalysisEngine.applyChoose(DSMSQLStatement, int, ITupleSet, int, int).
      protected void AnalysisEngine.evaluationComplete()
      Capture the end state of the tuples as one of the N possible outcomes.
      protected void AnalysisEngine.sendTransportTuples(NamedTuples after)
      Ignore this request since we will not really be sharing our transport tuples with other engines.
